str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be a lunatic, be moonstruck, epileptic.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Badly, evilly, wrongly. From kakos; badly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
